<a id="class_ResourceImporterCSVTranslation"></a>

# ResourceImporterCSVTranslation

**Inherits:** [ResourceImporter](class_resourceimporter.md) **<** [RefCounted](class_refcounted.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

Imports comma-separated values

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Comma-separated values are a plain text table storage format. The format's simplicity makes it easy to edit in any text editor or spreadsheet software. This makes it a common choice for game localization.

\ **Example CSV file:**\ 

```text
    keys,en,es,ja
    GREET,"Hello, friend!","Hola, amigo!",ã“ã‚“ã«ã¡ã¯
    ASK,How are you?,CÃ³mo estÃ¡?,å…ƒæ°—ã§ã™ã‹
    BYE,Goodbye,AdiÃ³s,ã•ã‚ˆã†ãªã‚‰
    QUOTE,"""Hello"" said the man.","""Hola"" dijo el hombre.",ã€Œã“ã‚“ã«ã¡ã¯ã€ç”·ã¯è¨€ã„ã¾ã—ãŸ
```

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="class_ResourceImporterCSVTranslation_property_compress"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **compress** = `true` [ğŸ”—](#class_ResourceImporterCSVTranslation_property_compress)

If ``true``, creates an [OptimizedTranslation](class_optimizedtranslation.md) instead of a [Translation](class_translation.md). This makes the resulting file smaller at the cost of a small CPU overhead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_ResourceImporterCSVTranslation_property_delimiter"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](class_int.md) **delimiter** = `0` [ğŸ”—](#class_ResourceImporterCSVTranslation_property_delimiter)

The delimiter to use in the CSV file. The default value matches the common CSV convention. Tab-separated values are sometimes called TSV files.
